Description.div: This table stores order line information, including item details and shipping information. Multiple lines can be created for a single order defined in the YFS_ORDER_HEADER table.
Unique identifier for the line.
Required Quantity.
Scac And Service Key
Shipping node.
Assignment node gives details on the availability of the inventory.
Assignment key of the choice.
Capacity for ShipDate at ShipNode.
Capacity consumed for ShipDate at ShipNode.
The unit of measure in which inventory resource pool capacity is specified.
Capacity utilization percentage of the node.
Delivery Date of the assignment
Distance between the Shipping Address and Node's address measured in MILES.

Date on which inventory and node capacity are available at the suggested ShipNode. This is applicable only for findInventory api when DetermineCarrierService flag is set to Y .
Note: NodeProcessingDate in user exit is shown only when sufficient capacity is available at node for assignment quantity.
Product Quantity that can be procured from another node
Date on which the product will be available at the suggested ShipNode.
Quantity that can be obtained for this assignemnt.
Carrier Code.
Shipment Date of the assignment
Node from which inventory is available
Carrier services available for this assignment. You may filter out these in the UE output.
Expected delivery date.
Expected shipment date.
Supplies of the assignment.
Supply of the assignment.
Available Quantity.
First Ship Date.
Last Ship Date.
Safety Factor Quantity.

The AvailableFromUnplannedInventory flag indicates that one or more assignments of the option consumes from the unplanned inventory when the UseUnplannedInventory flag is set to Y .
First Date inventory is available
Flag to indicate if there is any unavailable product or service quantity.
Last Date when Inventory can be obtained
Indicates least priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Indicates maximum priority across all product assignment's NodePriorities.
Total Quantity available at the Node through assignments.
Total number of shipments
DeliveryMethod used for obtaining the promise line. Possible values include Delivery DEL, Ship SHP or Pick Up PICK
Unique identifier for the line.
Required Quantity
Assignment node gives details on the availability of the inventory.
Delivery Date of the assignment
Distance between the Shipping Address and Node's address measured in MILES.
Specifies the reason for empty assignment.
Number of the interaction
This is a required attribute for supporting external availability. The value indicates the actual available quantity at the node.
Node which will be used for forwarding.
Priority of the Node.
Date on which inventory and node capacity are available at the suggested ShipNode. This is applicable only for findInventory api when DetermineCarrierService flag is set to Y
Product Quantity that can be procured from another node
Date on which the product will be available at the suggested ShipNode.
Quantity that can be obtained for this assignment.
The amount of unplanned inventory used by the assignment. In case of bundle parents, this will be 0.00.
Quantity from existing reservations used for the assignment.
Carrier Code determined by routing.
Quantity for which segment has been changed.
Shipment Date
Node from which inventory is available
Quantity substituted for the original item.
The multistop transfer number used for this assignment.
ItemID of the substitute Item
Substitute Items product quantity that can be procured from another node
Product class of the substitute Item
Quantity of the substitute Item
Substitute Items quantity from existing reservations used for the substitution.
Unit Of Measure of the substitute Item
Indicates node from which Substitute is being procured.
Indicates quantity being procured.
Shipment Date from the procurement node.
The multistop transfer number used for this procurement.
Indicates node from which product is being procured.
Date on which the product will be available at the suggested Procurement Node.
Indicates quantity being procured.
Shipment Date from the procurement node.
The multistop transfer number used for this procurement.

Interaction node gives details such as Date and Time when the product or service item is available. It provides information on whether the interaction involves a product item being delivery or if a service will be done at the specified time.
Date and Time when the appointment ends for Service Line
Date and Time when the appointment starts for Service Line
Carrier
Carrier service code.
Delivery date of the interaction. If not optimizing on date, this is the earliest delivery date across assignments for this interaction. Otherwise, it is the latest.
DeliveryMethod used for obtaining the promise line. Posible values include Delivery DEL, Ship SHP or Pick Up PICK
Number of the interaction
Flag to indicate if the promise line is a Delivery Line
Item Group Code of the Item present in line. Possible values are Product PROD, Delivery DS or Provided Service PS
The level of service to be used for this interaction.
Node from where the Service is being done
Organization Code
Shipment date of the interaction. If not optimizing on date, this is the earliest shipment date across assignments for this interaction. Otherwise, it is the latest.

Attribute.Name: isHistory
Attribute.Description: Flag to indicate if the address is in history tables.

Description.div: Costs of the option.
Currency in which cost is maintained.
Handling cost of the option.
Hours of Supply cost of the option.
Item inventory cost of the option.
Node priority cost of the option.
Node shipping capacity cost of the option.
Shipment delay cost of the option.
Total cost of the option.
Transportation cost of the option.
